conclusion: Analyze velocities and areas under curves on the v-t graph to determine maximum distance.
Car A: 0-10s velocity increases from 0 to 40 m/s; 10-30s velocity constant at 40 m/s. Car B: 0-30s velocity increases from 0 to 40 m/s.
Calculate distance for Car A from 0 to 10s as 200 m.
Calculate distance for Car A from 10 to 30s as 800 m.
Total distance traveled by Car A in 30s is 1000 m.
Calculate distance for Car B from 0 to 30s as 600 m.
At t=30s, both cars are side by side having traveled 1000 m.
Maximum distance occurs when Car A travels more than Car B between 10s and 30s.
Calculate Car A's distance from 10 to 30s as 800 m.
Calculate Car B's distance from 10 to 30s as 600 m.
Difference in distance between Car A and Car B is 200 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 200 meters.
